text: Alan McGregor Peart, (25 July 1922 – 5 September 2018) was a New Zealand fighter pilot and flying ace of the Second World War. A Spitfire pilot, he served in Europe, North Africa, and the Far East. Peart's combat success score was between 7.5 and 9.5 enemy aircraft destroyed, and between 7 and 9 others damaged. He was awarded the Distinguished Flying Cross on 2 June 1944. ==References== Category:1922 births Category:2018 deaths Category:New Zealand World War II pilots Category:People from Hamilton, New Zealand Category:People from Nelson, New Zealand Category:Recipients of the Distinguished Flying Cross (United Kingdom)
title: Alan Peart
